List of embattled drug firm customers expands

News Analysis

On big issues, goals
similar, but styles differ

On the biggest foreign policy questions in the final debate, Mitt Romney had trouble explaining what he would do differently from President Obama.
Opinion | Farah Stockman

Mitt Romney: Yeah, what he said

It was striking how many times Romney agreed with the president’s policies on Afghanistan, sanctions on Iran, and the decision not to use the US military in Syria.

State to review pharmacy monitoring

In 2006, the Framingham facility at the center of the nationwide meningitis outbreak was inspected by an Illinois firm whose CEO was, at the time, facing fraud charges.
Opinion | Joanna Weiss

The humor vote

This election cycle, the most potent political weapon might turn out to be a certain brand of subversive online jokes.

US pressed to release heating aid

Attorney General Martha Coakley is urging federal officials to help needy families pay to heat their homes by releasing billions in government funds.
Editorial | sixth district endorsement

Tisei brings voice of moderation

This year, Sixth District voters should elect GOP challenger Richard Tisei over Rep. John Tierney.
